tool_description: Determines the appropriate escalation path and next steps based on ticket priority, customer tier, issue type, and organizational hierarchy.

priority_level.description: Ticket priority level (low, medium, high, critical)

current_agent_level.description: Current handling agent level (l1, l2, l3, specialist)

escalation_reason.description: Reason for escalation (sla_breach, complexity, customer_request, technical)

business_hours.description: Whether escalation occurs during business hours

error_messages: Invalid priority level: Priority must be one of [low, medium, high, critical]. Check priority evaluation results.
Invalid customer tier: Customer tier must be one of [basic, premium, enterprise]. Verify customer classification.
Invalid agent level: Agent level must be one of [l1, l2, l3, specialist]. Check current assignment.
Invalid escalation reason: Reason must be one of [sla_breach, complexity, customer_request, technical].
No escalation path found: No suitable escalation path exists for the given parameters. Review escalation policies.
usage: Provide ticket priority, customer information, and escalation context to determine the next escalation step. The tool returns specific routing recommendations and required actions.

target_team.description: Team or department to escalate to

urgency_flag.description: Whether this escalation requires immediate attention

required_approvals.description: List of required approvals for escalation
